messages.subject: Sumiyoshi Shrine
messages.msgSnippet: All, I have a Toshu guard carrying the theme of the Tori and pine tree of the Sumiyoshi Shrine. I am looking into the significance of this shrine is in regards
messages.messageBody:
All, I have a Toshu guard carrying the theme of the Tori and pine tree of the Sumiyoshi Shrine. I am looking into the significance of this shrine is in regards to kodogu as it is a popular theme. The shrine itself is of the pagoda style, and on the Internet, I have so far found many reference pics of this and also the mention of Genji, with the shrine being a favorite visiting place. .

There is also a few references showing the Tori used in the tsuba's design described at the main gate or entrance to the shrine. I assume as the tori and the pine tree's are used the most in tsuba design, they are significant in recognizing the shrine.

Is it the Shrine that is the main theme here, or the shrine through the reference of Genji ?, or is Genji the main point and the shrine is being used as reference ?.

Toshu Ju Kuniyoshi Saku
http://www.whiz.com.au/richard/Tsuba/kuniyoshi-front.jpg

Sumiyoshi Shrine Tori
http://kyushu.com/images/places_to_go/pup_sumiyoshi_left_pic.jpg"

Cheers all

Rich





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
